workflow.name: Build an internet search chatbot with Firecrawl API
workflow.description:
## Internet Search Chat with Firecrawl

### How it works
1. A user sends a query via the chat widget and the Chat Trigger captures the message.
2. The chat flow posts the query to the backend webhook (HTTP Request) which forwards it to the search service.
3. The webhook calls Firecrawl to run the web search and returns raw results.
4. A formatter converts the raw results into concise Markdown blocks and separators.
5. The chat node sends the formatted search summary back to the user.
6. Optional: an admin can manually trigger a credits check to review Firecrawl usage.

### Setup
- [ ] Add Firecrawl API credentials in n8n.
- [ ] Update the webhook URL in the "Define constants" node to your n8n instance URL.
- [ ] Configure and enable the Chat Trigger (make it public and set initial messages).
- [ ] Ensure the webhook node path matches the constant and is reachable from the chat node.
- [ ] Test the chat by sending a sample query and verify the formatted search results.
- [ ] (Optional) Run the manual "Check credits" trigger to monitor Firecrawl account usage.

parameters.content:
## Internet Search Service with Firecrawl
Backend search service responsible for processing search requests.
Receives search queries from the chat interface, executes the web search via Firecrawl, structures the results, and returns the response to the calling interface flow.

## Internet Search Chat Interface
Handles user-facing chat interactions for the Internet Search feature.
Receives chat messages, forwards the search query to the backend Firecrawl service, formats the returned data, and sends the final response back to the user.

## Firecrawl Account Credits Monitor
Monitors Firecrawl account credit usage.
Allows manual triggering to check the remaining available credits, returning the usage summary and terminating the monitor flow.

options.title: Interface de Chat para Busca na Internet
options.subtitle: Alysson Neves (https://n8n.io/creators/alysson)

parameters.initialMessages: ü§ñ Ol√°! Como posso ajudar voc√™ hoje?

nodes.name: Reply to the user in the chat

parameters.pythonCode:
import json

# Retrieve the JSON payload from the previous node
data = items[0].get("json", {})

# If the payload is a JSON string, parse it into a Python object
if isinstance(data, str):
    data = json.loads(data)

# If the payload is a list, use the first element as the main object
if isinstance(data, list) and data:
    data = data[0]

# Navigate to data.web, which is expected to be a list of web items
web_items = data.get("data", {}).get("web", [])

blocks = []

for item in web_items:
    position = str(item.get("position", ""))
    url = item.get("url", "")
    title = item.get("title", "")
    description = item.get("description", "")

    # Build a clickable Markdown link using the URL, if present
    markdown_link = f"[{url}]({url})" if url else ""

    # Build the heading line:
    # - Use "####" to create a smaller heading
    # - Escape the closing parenthesis to avoid Markdown list interpretation
    if position and title:
        title_line = f"#### {position}\\) {title}"
    elif position:
        title_line = f"#### {position}\\)"
    elif title:
        title_line = f"#### {title}"
    else:
        title_line = ""

    # Each block has the format:
    # 1) Heading (title_line)
    # 2) Description
    # 3) Clickable link
    block_lines = [title_line, description, markdown_link]

    # Join non-empty lines with a blank line between them
    block = "\n\n".join(line for line in block_lines if line)
    blocks.append(block)

# Use a horizontal separator between result blocks
output_text = "\n\n-----\n\n".join(blocks).strip()

return [{
    "json": {
        "output": output_text
    }
}]

parameters.content:
## Internet Search Chat with Firecrawl

### How it works
1. A user sends a query via the chat widget and the Chat Trigger captures the message.
2. The chat flow posts the query to the backend webhook (HTTP Request) which forwards it to the search service.
3. The webhook calls Firecrawl to run the web search and returns raw results.
4. A formatter converts the raw results into concise Markdown blocks and separators.
5. The chat node sends the formatted search summary back to the user.
6. Optional: an admin can manually trigger a credits check to review Firecrawl usage.

### Setup
- [ ] Add Firecrawl API credentials in n8n.
- [ ] Update the webhook URL in the "Define constants" node to your n8n instance URL.
- [ ] Configure and enable the Chat Trigger (make it public and set initial messages).
- [ ] Ensure the webhook node path matches the constant and is reachable from the chat node.
- [ ] Test the chat by sending a sample query and verify the formatted search results.
- [ ] (Optional) Run the manual "Check credits" trigger to monitor Firecrawl account usage.
